subject: RE: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Which lexical set is the second vowel of _because_ in?
msgSnippet: Hi Peter Do you have a lot of words, that do not break down easily into phonemes? I d like to know what they are, if they are not too many. Regards, Paul V.
messageBody:
Hi Peter
Do you have a lot of words, that do not break down easily into phonemes?
I'd like to know what they are, if they are not too many.
Regards, Paul V.
_____________attached___________________

To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
From: malt99@...
Date: Tue, 6 Jan 2009 12:29:52 +0000
Subject: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Which lexical set is the second vowel of _because_ in?


--- In Read_Alphabet@ yahoogroups. com, "peter_r_guinness" <malt99@...>
wrote:
>
> Is the second syllable vowel of _because_ in the THOUGHT set?
> In "Longman's Pronunciation Dictionary" for RP it is listed as
either
> /Q/ or /@/, and for GA it is /A:/, /Q:/, /V/ or /@/.
> I'm guessing it is a THOUGHT member even though the RP in Longman's
> doesn't have an /O/ alternative which is the most common (normally
> only) one for THOUGHT words in RP.
>

For myself (Australian) I use /O:/ to give something like: 'beekorze'.
Also in Longman's it notes that some British English (but non-RP) use
/O/ also. (/O/ is typical of THOUGHT set).

I've created a file "hard_basket" in my intQS project where I shall
put words that I don't know what to do with.
